examples.title: Hello World
examples.description: Your first program! Outputs the number 72 (ASCII code for 'H').

examples.title: Simple Addition
examples.description: Learn variables and arithmetic by adding two numbers.

examples.title: Input Echo
examples.description: Read user input and echo it back. Demonstrates I/O operations.

examples.title: Counter Loop
examples.description: Count from 0 to 5 using a FOR loop.

examples.title: Conditional Test
examples.description: Check if input is greater than 50 and print 1 or 0.

examples.title: Accumulator
examples.description: Add numbers until total exceeds 100. Demonstrates accumulation pattern.

examples.title: Countdown
examples.description: Count down from 10 to 0. Shows manual loop control.

examples.title: Maximum Finder
examples.description: Find the maximum of two numbers using conditionals.

examples.title: [ASM] Echo Input
examples.description: Assembly: Read input and echo it back. Demonstrates IN and OUT instructions.

examples.title: [ASM] Add Two Numbers
examples.description: Assembly: Add two numbers using memory and registers.

examples.title: [ASM] Hello World
examples.description: Assembly: Output 'HI' using ASCII codes. Your first assembly program!

examples.title: [ASM] Logic Operations
examples.description: Assembly: Demonstrates AND, OR, XOR, NOT bitwise operations.

examples.title: [ASM] Conditional Loop
examples.description: Assembly: Count to 10 using CMP and JNZ for conditional looping.

examples.title: [ASM] Stack Demo
examples.description: Assembly: Demonstrates PUSH and POP stack operations. Shows how to save and restore register values.

examples.title: [ASM] Memory Operations
examples.description: Assembly: Shows LDM and STM for loading and storing values in memory.

examples.title: [ASM] MOV Register
examples.description: Assembly: Demonstrates MOV instruction for copying data between registers.

examples.title: [ASM] Complex Program
examples.description: Assembly: Combines multiple concepts - input, arithmetic, logic, loops, and output.

examples.title: Memory Demo (POKE/PEEK)
examples.description: Store and retrieve values using POKE and PEEK for direct memory access.

examples.title: [ASM] Data Storage
examples.description: Assembly: Store and retrieve data in the free RAM area using LDM/STM.

categories.name: Memory
categories.description: Direct memory access with POKE and PEEK
